fields_of_interest: Education and training, Research and innovation, Communication
eu_initiatives:
Our main interest is in the Open Science Policy Platform OSPP (DG-RTD) 
 
Our board members are also involved in working groups at a governmental level, mainly in the UK.  This has involved meetings in person and review of reports via email.  We have also made public support online for initiatives such as The Hague declaration.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
relevant_communication:
We organise an annual conference to bring together key stakeholders in open access publishing, to discuss developments and share experiences.  
 
We hold webinars for our members, which are later made public, on various aspects of maintaining standards in scholarly publishing. 
 
We have reviewed and endorsed the Wellcome Trust's Open Access Monograph Guide for Publishers. 
 
Our membership criteria and published 'Principles of Transparency and Best Practice in Scholarly Publishing' reflect developments in scholarly communications.
goals__remit:
Our mission is to represent the interests of Open Access (OA) journal and book publishers globally in all scientific, technical and scholarly disciplines. This mission will be carried out through exchanging information, setting standards, advancing models, advocacy, education, and the promotion of innovation. 
 
Through a shared interest in developing appropriate business models, tools and standards to support OA publishing, we can ensure a prosperous and sustainable future to the benefit of our members and the scholarly communities they serve.
